title.narrative: WATERSHED MANAGEMENT AND AGRICULTURAL SUPPORT PROJECT

description.narrative: This project aimed at increasing agricultural productivity on the islands of Santo Antao, Fogo, and Sao Nicolau by improving water management and soil conservation, strengthening agribusiness development services, and increasing access to credit.

title.narrative: Harnessing Watersheds for Agricultural Support in Cabo Verde

condition.narrative: Community-based water resource management plans developed for each of the three watershed areas, and implemented and continued compliance, satisfactory to MCC, in subsequent years.
Environmental and Social Assessment Manager is selected and remains engaged or in the event the position is vacant, MCACV is actively recruiting.
MCC Approval of Water Resource Monitoring Plan and continued implementation of the approved plan throughout the Compact term satisfactory to MCC.
Satisfactory current Implementation Plan (including the Detailed Financial Plan, Procurement Plan, Work Plans and M&E Plans) is submitted to MCC.

The Government has eliminated regulatory and legal obstacles to movement of inspected and certified horticultural products, including taking all necessary regulatory or other actions to lift the embargo on exports of horticultural products from Santo Ant?o.
The Implementing Entities are selected by MCA-Cape Verde, approved by MCC, engaged and remain in place during implementation of Project.
The Ministry of Environment and Agriculture and the Outside Project Manager has implemented a fee for services policy (satisfactory to MCC), charging fees for quality inspections, and certifications.
Watershed Project Manager for MCA-Cape Verde is selected and remains engaged, or in the event the position is vacant, MCA-CV is actively recruiting.
